DataElement.preferredName: Microinvasive Breast Carcinoma Suspicious for Malignancy Focus Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to indicate if there is a central point or locus of a microscopic finding indicating the presence of Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) of the breast.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Microinvasive Breast Carcinoma Suspicious for Malignancy Focus
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Ductal carcinoma in situ of the breast with minimal stromal invasion.  Lymph node involvement is uncommon and the prognosis is generally good._A microscopic finding indicating the presence of a cellular infiltrate or isolated cells that have features suspicious for malignancy._Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Ductal carcinoma in situ of the breast with minimal stromal invasion.  Lymph node involvement is uncommon and the prognosis is generally good.

Concepts.definition: Invasive breast carcinoma measuring 1 mm or less in size.

Property.preferredDefinition: A microscopic finding indicating the presence of a cellular infiltrate or isolated cells that have features suspicious for malignancy.:Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.

Concepts.definition: A microscopic finding indicating the presence of a cellular infiltrate or isolated cells that have features suspicious for malignancy.
Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
